content:
You are Melius Engine, an autonomous AI agent. 
        Current Event/Request from event.json: blackholes is topic and thream no builk animatedobjectsslide animatedpage and about blackholes.
        
        Repository files: ['LICENSE', 'README.md', 'event.json', 'DESIGN.md', 'test-website/styles.css', 'test-website/index.html', 'test-website/script.js', 'test-website/package.json', 'test-website/vercel.json', 'docs/styles.css', 'docs/.nojekyll', 'docs/index.html', 'docs/script.js', 'github-page/styles.css', 'github-page/index.html', 'github-page/script.js']
        Existing To-Dos: [{'file': 'test-website/script.js', 'pending': 'Complete the JavaScript content to ensure all buttons have proper event handlers and functionality'}, {'file': 'test-website/styles.css', 'pending': 'Fix the SVG data URL to include proper SVG content for Egyptian-themed patterns.'}, {'file': 'test-website/script.js', 'pending': 'The script.js file needs to be updated with the improved mobile menu toggle functionality as described in the intent.'}, {'file': 'test-website/script.js', 'pending': 'Fix the syntax errors in the showSlide function and complete the JavaScript content to ensure all functions are properly implemented.'}, {'file': 'test-website/index.html', 'pending': 'Complete the HTML content to ensure all buttons have proper event handlers and styling'}, {'file': 'test-website/script.js', 'pending': "Fix the syntax error by adding the missing closing brace for the 'beforeunload' event listener function."}, {'file': 'test-website/script.js', 'pending': 'Add event listeners and functionality for the new buttons added in test-website/index.html'}, {'file': 'test-website/styles.css', 'pending': 'Complete the CSS file with the full intended dark, cosmic theme including animations for black hole visuals, swirling effects, and glowing elements.'}, {'file': 'test-website/script.js', 'pending': "Fix the syntax error by removing the word 'pełni' and re-implement the mobile menu toggle functionality with proper event handling, smooth transitions, and user-friendly interactions as described in the intent"}, {'file': 'test-website/client/src/App.tsx', 'pending': "Add Link imports from 'wouter' for navigation elements"}, {'file': 'test-website/client/src/App.tsx', 'pending': 'Add useState hook to manage mobile menu state'}, {'file': 'test-website/index.html', 'pending': 'Complete the HTML content to ensure all sections are properly included, such as the main content area with interactive planets, animated slides, and other sections related to black holes.'}, {'file': 'test-website/index.html', 'pending': 'Add a mobile-friendly navigation menu with a hamburger icon for better usability on mobile devices.'}, {'file': 'test-website/styles.css', 'pending': 'Complete the CSS file to include all necessary styles for the black hole theme, animations, and interactive elements.'}, {'file': 'test-website/styles.css', 'pending': 'Fix the SVG data URL in --black-hole-pattern-5 to include proper SVG content and ensure it is correctly formatted.'}, {'file': 'test-website/styles.css', 'pending': 'The CSS file needs to be updated with Egyptian-themed color palette and UI elements as described in the intent.'}]
        Existing Errors: []

        CONSTRAINTS:
        1. You can ONLY modify UI-related files (CSS, TSX components, basic UI theme).
        2. DO NOT modify build files, configurations, or dependencies (vercel.json, package.json, vite.config.ts, etc.).
        3. Do not ask to re-read files if they are already in the context.
        4. Focus exclusively on UI theme changes based on the event: blackholes is topic and thream no builk animatedobjectsslide animatedpage and about blackholes..
        
        Analyze the project and suggest UI/Theme improvements. 
        If you need to read specific files, list them in "files_to_read".
        
        
CRITICAL:
Return JSON in this exact format:

{
  "files_to_read": [],
  "analysis": "string",
  "improvements": [
    {
      "file": "relative/path.tsx",
      "description": "precise UI change"
    }
  ]
}

Do NOT add extra keys.
Do NOT nest improvements.
Do NOT return prose outside JSON.

Modify UI for: test-website/index.html Description: Complete the HTML content to ensure all sections are properly included, such as the main content area with interactive planets, animated slides, and other sections related to black holes. Black Hole Gallery

Explore stunning images and visualizations of black holes from around the universe.

M87 Black Hole

The first-ever image of a black hole, captured by the Event Horizon Telescope.

Sagittarius A*

The supermassive black hole at the center of our Milky Way galaxy.

Cygnus X-1

One of the first black holes ever discovered, located in the constellation Cygnus.

Centaurus A

A supermassive black hole in the galaxy Centaurus A, known for its powerful jets.

Black Hole Timeline

A chronological journey through the major discoveries and milestones in black hole research.

1783 - John Michell

John Michell proposes the concept of "dark stars" with gravity so strong that light cannot escape.

1915 - Einstein's Theory

Albert Einstein publishes his theory of general relativity, providing the mathematical framework for black holes.

Planet Information

Click on a planet to learn more about its interaction with black holes.

Black Hole Gallery

Explore stunning images and visualizations of black holes from around the universe.

M87 Black Hole

The first-ever image of a black hole, captured by the Event Horizon Telescope.

Sagittarius A*

The supermassive black hole at the center of our Milky Way galaxy.

Cygnus X-1

One of the first black holes ever discovered, located in the constellation Cygnus.

Centaurus A

A supermassive black hole in the galaxy Centaurus A, known for its powerful jets.

Black Hole Timeline

A chronological journey through the major discoveries and milestones in black hole research.

1783 - John Michell

John Michell proposes the concept of "dark stars" with gravity so strong that light cannot escape.

1915 - Einstein's Theory

Albert Einstein publishes his theory of general relativity, providing the mathematical framework for black holes.

1967 - Term "Black Hole" Coined

John Wheeler introduces the term "black hole" to describe these cosmic phenomena.

1971 - First Black Hole Discovered

Cynthia and James Westphal discover Cygnus X-1, the first confirmed black hole.

2019 - First Image of a Black Hole

The Event Horizon Telescope collaboration captures the first image of a black hole in the galaxy M87.

Black Hole Formation

Learn about the different ways black holes can form in the universe.

Stellar Collapse

When a massive star runs out of fuel, it can collapse under its own gravity, forming a black hole.

Supermassive Black Holes

These giants are thought to form from the merging of smaller black holes and the accretion of matter over billions of years.

Primordial Black Holes

These hypothetical black holes could have formed in the early universe due to density fluctuations.

Black Hole Effects

Discover the fascinating effects black holes have on their surroundings.

Gravitational Time Dilation

Time slows down near a black hole due to its immense gravitational pull.

Spaghettification

Objects approaching a black hole are stretched into long, thin shapes due to tidal forces.

Event Horizon

The boundary beyond which nothing, not even light, can escape the black hole's gravitational pull.

Accretion Disks

Material spiraling into a black hole forms a hot, glowing disk of gas and dust.

Contact

Have questions or want to learn more? Get in touch with us!

© 2024 Black Hole Explorer. All rights reserved.

Explore the mysteries of the universe with us!
